page.title: 17HOW BRYNFORD HAS CHANGED
page.content: The lady we interviewed has been in Brynford nearly 83 years. She thought Brynford has changed a lot. Brynford looked very poor during the war. She likes Brynford better now. She went to Brynford school. She thought Brynford wasn't as cosy after the Avenue was built.When they were young they had to make their own games.She wants the new road to be convenient for her. She would like the sheep to be away because sheep-muck often gets on her carpet. At first Brynford was a nice, small village where all the people new each other but the new houses have spoilt it and people don't know each other very well.There's a lot of vandalism in the village;windows being smashed and fires being lit on the mountain. So Brynford has changed a lot.
